Label: microtubule-binding region
Description: The motif in the MAPT protein where microtubule binding repeats

Label: tubulin-binding repeat 1
Description: position 569_591 of canonical isoform of MAPT protein

Label: tubulin-binding repeat 2
Description: position 592_621 of canonical isoform of MAPT protein

Label: tubulin-binding repeat 3
Description: position 623_653 of canonical isoform of MAPT protein

Label: tubulin-binding repeat 4
Description: position 654_685 of canonical isoform of MAPT protein

Label: Tau aggregates
Description: Tau (MAPT) in its aggregated form (as Paired Helical Filaments (PHFs) or Straight Filaments (SF)) contains 5–9 moles of phosphate/ mole of the protein, defining it as hyper phosphorylated

Label: hyperphosphorylation
Description: An excessive phosphorylation (see GO:0006468)

Label: GAL80TS
Description: temperature-sensitive allele of GAL80 (tub-GAL80TS)

Label: Tau oligomers
Description: CAST is known to prevent oligomerization of Tau (Rao et al., 2014) and α-synuclein (Diepenbroek et al. 2014) and inhibit reactive gliosis (Rao et al., 2008)

Label: LY293002
Description: a specific PI3-kinase inhibitor

Label: LPLI
Description: Low-power laser irradiation (LPLI) is a non-damage physical therapy

Label: Chronic cerebral hypoperfusion
Description: Chronic cerebral hypoperfusion (CCH) is one of the causes of vascular dementia (VaD) and is also an etiological factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD)

Label: Mori Fructus ethanol extract
Description: ethanol extracted from Mori Fructus, a well-known traditional herbal medicine, food, and dietary supplement

Label: tunneling nanotubes
Description: filamentous-actin-containing membranous structures that bridge and connect cells

Label: amyloidogenesis
Description: production of amyloid

Label: alpha-synuclein aggregates
Description: alpha-synuclein (SNCA) aggregate in fibrillar or oligomeric forms, usually found in Lewy bodies

Label: huntingtin aggregates
Description: huntingtin (HTT) protein fragments aggregations

Label: amyloid-beta aggregates
Description: aggregation of amyloid-beta fragments of the APP protein

Label: SEN-1269
Description: A tau aggregation inhibitor

Label: MLS000034832
Description: A tau aggregation inhibitor

Label: caprospinol
Description: A tau aggregation inhibitor

Label: amyloid-beta oligomers
Description: Small aggregates of amyloid-beta

Label: amyloid-beta 42 oligomers
Description: Amyloid-beta oligomers composed specifically of amyloid-beta 42

Label: APP C-terminally truncated carboxyl-terminal fragments
Description: C-terminally truncated carboxyl-terminal fragments (CTFs) of APP

Label: A2B5 antigen
Description: A2B5 antigen is a cell surface ganglioside epitope expressed on developing thymic epithelial cells, oligodendrocyte progenitors, and neuroendocrine cells.

Label: neutral sphingomyelinase
Description: Sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase (EC 3.1.4.12, also known as neutral sphingomyelinase, sphingomyelinase, or SMase) is a hydrolase enzyme that is involved in sphingolipid metabolism reactions.

Label: Neurodegeneration
Description: Neurodegeneration is the progressive loss of structure or function of neurons, including death of neurons. Many neurodegenerative diseases – including amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, Alzheimer's disease, and Huntington's disease – occur as a result of neurodegenerative processes.

Label: amyloid-beta derived diffusible ligands
Description: soluble oligomeric forms of the amyloid beta peptide known as amyloid-derived diffusible ligands (ADDLs) are the toxic species responsible for neurodegeneration associated with Alzheimer's disease.

Label: Hyperamylinemia
Description: increased secretion of the pancreatic hormone amylin

Label: APOE e4
Description: APOE e4 is a variant of APOE, it's APOE-ε4 (arg112, arg158).

Label: N-AcGIP
Description: N-AcGIP is agonist of GIP

Label: Pro3-GIP
Description: Pro3-GIP is agonist of GIP

Label: PI3K-Akt signaling pathway
Description: PI3K-Akt signaling pathway is an intracellular signaling pathway important in regulating the cell cycle.It is described in KEGG.

Label: Neurodegeneration
Description: Neurodegeneration is the progressive loss of structure or function of neurons, including death of neurons.

Label: Argyrophilic Grain Disease
Description: Argyrophilic grain disease (AGD) is an under-recognized, distinct, highly frequent sporadic tauopathy, with a prevalence reaching 31.3% in centenarians.

Label: granulovacuolar degeneration
Description: Granulovacuolar degeneration (GVD) is one of the pathological hallmarks of Alzheimer's disease (AD), and it is defined as electron-dense granules within double membrane-bound cytoplasmic vacuoles.

Label: mitochondrial dysfunction
Description: mitochondria function disorder

Label: amyloid-beta fibrils
Description: Insoluble fibrous protein aggregates exhibiting beta sheet structure.

Label: AG73
Description: a peptide derived from mouse laminin alpha 1 protein (seq:RKRLQVQLSIRT, chain:2719–2730)

Label: Notch intracellular domain
Description: Notch intracellular domain is the intracellular region of notch receptor.

Label: YENPTY endocytosis motif (APP)
Description: YENTY is the endocytosis motif of Amyloid precursor protein.

Label: sAPP-beta
Description: Soluble amyloid precursor protein

Label: growth factor
Description: A growth factor is a naturally occurring substance capable of stimulating cellular growth, proliferation, healing, and cellular differentiation. Usually it is a protein or a steroid hormone. Growth factors are important for regulating a variety of cellular processes.

Label: 3R tau
Description: Tau isoforms containing 3 tubulin binding repeats

Label: 4R tau
Description: Tau isoforms containing 4 tubulin binding repeats

Label: VQIINK motif
Description: A hexapeptide motif located in the R2, that promotes the formation of PHF

Label: VQIVYK motif
Description: A hexapeptide motif located in the R3, that promotes the formation of PHF

Label: ghost tangles
Description: Extracellular NFT remains after neuron death, considered to be the last stage of NFT-related pathological activity.

Label: pretangles
Description: Pretangles are cytoplasmic tau immunoreactivity in neurons without apparent formation of fibrillary structures. In Alzheimer disease, such tau deposition is considered to represent a premature state prior to fibril formation (AD-pretangles), later to form neurofibrillary tangles and finally ghost tangles.

Label: projection domain
Description: Corresponding roughly to the N-terminal part of the tau molecule, consisting mainly of acidic residues and containing two distinct alternatively spliced N-terminal inserts.

Label: RAC1b
Description: A constitutively active splicing isoform of RAC1 (Ras-related C3 botulinum toxin substrate 1), first identified in breast and colon cancer.

Label: AP-2 complex
Description: A heterotetrameric adapter protein complex involved in cargo-internalization during clathrin-mediated endocytosis. Composed of alpha and beta subunits (large adaptins), mu and sigma subunits (minor adaptins).

Label: Tau isoform F (441 aa)
Description: Longest tau isoform in human brain, most commonly used as the conventional tau.

Label: Tau isoform Fetal-tau (352 aa)
Description: Human fetal tau isoform.

Label: Tau isoform B (381 aa)
Description: Human brain tau isoform, derived from alternative splicing.

Label: Tau isoform D (383 aa)
Description: Human brain tau isoform, derived from alternative splicing.

Label: Tau isoform C (410 aa)
Description: Human brain tau isoform, derived from alternative splicing.

Label: Tau isoform E (412 aa)
Description: Human brain tau isoform, derived from alternative splicing.

Label: neuroinflammation
Description: inflammatory response in the brain and nervous tissue.

Label: neurotoxicity
Description: happens when a biological, physical or chemical agent cause any adverse effect on the structure and function of the nerves system.

Label: neurite retraction
Description: when the neurite is unable it outgrow and extend

Label: APP695
Description: the APP gene is located on chromosome 21 in humans with three major isoforms arising from alternative splicing [3]. These are APP695, APP751 and APP770 (containing 695, 751, and 770 amino acids, respectively)

Label: APP751
Description: the APP gene is located on chromosome 21 in humans with three major isoforms arising from alternative splicing [3]. These are APP695, APP751 and APP770 (containing 695, 751, and 770 amino acids, respectively)

Label: APP770
Description: the APP gene is located on chromosome 21 in humans with three major isoforms arising from alternative splicing [3]. These are APP695, APP751 and APP770 (containing 695, 751, and 770 amino acids, respectively)

Label: gamma-secretase
Description: gamma-secretase is a high molecular weight complex minimally composed of four components: presenilins (PS), nicastrin, anterior pharynx defective 1 (APH-1), and presenilin enhancer 2 (PEN-2)

Label: sAPP-alpha
Description: soluble amyloid precursor protein-alpha

Label: Excitotoxicity
Description: Excitotoxicity is defined as cell death resulting from the toxic actions of excitatory amino acids

Label: C31
Description: a fragment containing the last 31 amino acids of APP (called C31)

Label: Jcasp
Description: Additional gamma-cleavage further generates the fragment (called Jcasp) containing the region between gamma- and caspase-cleavage sites

Label: AICD
Description: APP intracellular domain

Label: p83
Description: APP alphaCTF and betaCTF are further cleaved by gamma-secretase to generate p83 and Abeta, respectively

Label: APP processing
Description: Any protein maturation process achieved by the cleavage of a peptide bond or bonds within a protein (see:GO:0016485)

Label: AβOs
Description: soluble Aβ oligomers

Label: LMW amyloid oligomers
Description: The formation of AβOs starts from alterations in the conformation of monomeric Aβ, resulting in low molecular weight (LMW) dimers and trimers, followed by aggregation to soluble spherical oligomers consisted of 12–24 monomers.

Label: amyloid-beta 40 oligomers
Description: Amyloid-beta oligomers composed specifically of amyloid-beta 40

Label: alternative splicing of APP gene
Description: The process of generating multiple mRNA molecules from a given set of exons by differential use of exons from the primary transcript(s) to form multiple mature mRNAs that vary in their exon composition (see:GO:0000380)

Label: E1 domain
Description: The ectodomains of APP and APLPs have two conserved regions called E1 and E2 (Fig. 1A), both of which have been proposed to contribute to dimerization

Label: E2 domain
Description: The ectodomains of APP and APLPs have two conserved regions called E1 and E2 (Fig. 1A), both of which have been proposed to contribute to dimerization

Label: P3 peptide
Description: Cleavage by α-secretase yields the nonamyloidogenic soluble 3-kDa peptide (p3) that does not form amyloid fibrils, whereas cleavage by β-secretase yields the amyloidogenic form Aβ1–40 or the longer, more fibrillogenic Aβ1–42

Label: C99
Description: a membrane associated C-terminal fragment consisting of 99 amino acids (C99)

Label: aMCI
Description: amnestic Mild Cognitive Impairement is a cognitive dysfunction that is associated with memory deficits

Label: mdMCI
Description: multi-domain Mild Cognitive Impairement is a cognitive dysfunction that is associated with more than one cognitive domain

Label: Tau isoform A (316 aa)
Description: Human brain tau isoform, derived from alternative splicing.

Label: Tau C3
Description: Tau epitope cleaved at aspartic acid(421).

Label: Tau MN423
Description: Tau epitope truncated at glutamic acid(391).

Label: granular tau oligomers
Description: When the oligomer lengthens, it adapts a beta-sheet structure and transforms into a detergent-insoluble aggregate with granular appearance under Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM)

Label: Tau fibrils
Description: As these granular tau oligomers fuse together, they form tau fibrils, which ultimately form NFTs

Label: dense core plaques
Description: Dense-core plaques are fibrillar deposits of Abeta, showing all the classical properties of amyloid including beta-sheet secondary structure, while diffuse plaques are amorphous deposits

Label: Tau annular protofibrils
Description: A handful of proteins implicated in neurodegenerative diseases have been found to produce pore-like amyloid structures known as annular protofibrils (APFs)

Label: TOC1
Description: monoclonal antibody, named TOC1 (tau oligomeric complex 1), which selectively labels tau dimers and oligomers, but does not label filaments
